title: Coonoor  a peaceful treat in the Nilgiri Hills
text:
Coonoor, a small hill station of the Nilgiris, is a very popular tourist destination. The wonderful scenery is breathtaking. Here is a short description of the place for more visits the place. 


Coonoor , a small hill station of Tamil Nadu, stands at an altitude of 1800 m above the sea level. Coonoor is very famous for its production of Nilgiri tea. Coonoor was discovered in the 19th century by the British. It is the native place of Toda Tribe. Situated amidst lush and green tea leaves, Coonoor is a perfect escape for a weekend. This picturesque hill station has its own charm. Coonoor is a real treat to the visitors. The appealing tea gardens, the variety of rich flora, etc. are what make Coonoor so beautiful. The tea gardens are full of rich vegetation and tea plantation is the main source of living. Coonoor’s earning also depends on the seasonal tourist traffic. Coonoor can be a vacation of a lifetime. Coonoor hotels are are good at hospitality as they cater their guests with good facilities. 

Ooty is approximately 19 km away from Coonoor. Coonoor can be the ideal base camp for the trekker. Ooty Lake is one of the popular places to visit, where the houseboat offers a pleasant boating to the tourists. Coonoor provides options for recreation and sightseeing in plenty. Tourists will enjoy every bit of Coonoor. 

Dolphin’s Nose Viewpoint is the place which has a unique charm and it gives a panoramic view of the plains, at one side the deep forest mountain and at other Catherine falls. 
Sim’s Park spread over 12 hectares was built in the year 1874. The park consists of some unusual species of plants and naturally-occurring trees. Plus, this park holds a two-day fruit festival which is indeed offers some very sweet fruits. 

Hidden Valley situated in the surroundings of Coonoor is a romantic place. The view of hidden valley is very pleasurable to mind. 

The tranquil atmosphere of Coonoor is breathtaking. Well, there are enough budget hotels in Coonoor that are located near these places of attractions. Coonoor has a good local transport system, so reaching this popular tourist destination is very easy. The best time to visit Coonoor is from September to December. 

How to reach Coonoor? 
The nearest airport is the Coimbatore which is 110 km away from Coonoor. From Coonoor, it takes only 2 hours to reach the airport. Regular flights connect Coimbatore to other major cities of India. Mettupalayam is the nearest railway station from where the tourists get an option to enjoy the Toy Train that runs between Ooty and Mettupalayam via Coonoor. Coonoor is smartly connected by road to other cities. Tourist buses and cabs are readily available as soon as you reach this beautiful Nilgiri land. Coonoor hotels are located in the vicinity; they serve their guests with good accommodations. Since there are not many hotels, so it is recommended to book rooms prior to your visit to Coonoor. The hotel also offers quality range of food and they even offer pick and drop service.
